1. The eye entrance - the part of the body that faces form.

The subtle element of the body faculty,

Namely, the four elements, the four subtle elements,
The subtle element of the body faculty,ğŸ”½And the subtle element of the nose faculty.

Namely, the four elements and the four subtle elements.
The body faculty is subtle.
The tongue faculty is subtle.

The body is a form created by the four elements.

1. The sense base of form - all that is opposed to the eye,
the form that is seen is called form.
Form is of two kinds: form,
which includes all forms.
1. The visible form of the body -

2. The visible form of the environment -
the external forms that are not sentient, such as blue, yellow, red, white, black, and so on.
2. The sense base of sound - all that is opposed to the ear,
the sound that is heard is called sound.

which includes all sounds.

2. The sound that comes from the environment.

which includes all smells.

Second, the fragrance produced by the form of the dependent environment.
The fragrances and foul odors in all external ignorant forms.

The six tastes in the bodies of sentient beings.

In the bodies of sentient beings.
The sixteen touches such as cold, warmth, roughness, and smoothness.
Second, the touch of the form realm of the dependent environment.
The sixteen touches such as cold and warmth in all external ignorant forms.

The reason for distinguishing the eighteen realms is as follows.
Because those who are deluded are heavily confused about both name and form.
The form aggregate is divided into ten.

The general name element is used because the elements are distinguished.

Therefore, they are generally given the name element.ğŸ”½The six internal sense bases - these are fully explained above.

1. The eye consciousness element - when the eye faculty encounters a form object,

It is the body consciousness.
When the body consciousness arises,

Therefore, it is called the body consciousness element.
The sixth, the element of mental consciousness - the five consciousnesses arise and then cease.
The mind is the mental consciousness.
This mental consciousness continues to arise.
When the mental consciousness arises,
it is the consciousness that cognizes the object of dharmas.
If the five consciousnesses can give rise to the mental consciousness,
then the previous five consciousnesses are the root,
and the subsequent mental consciousness is the mental consciousness.
This mental consciousness ceases, and the next consciousness continues to arise.
This means that the previous mental consciousness gives rise to the subsequent mental consciousness.
In this way, it also escapes being called the root consciousness.
All use the able to give rise as the root,
and the given rise to as the consciousness.
Now, it is said that the given rise to consciousness
is the element of mental consciousness.

Falsely imagining that I can nurture others.
Therefore, it is called the one who nurtures.

Therefore, it is called the one who nurtures.
Seventh, the multitude - among the dharmas of name, form, aggregates, sense bases, and elements, etc.
Falsely imagining that I have the five aggregates of name and form,
The twelve sense bases, eighteen elements, and other causes and conditions.

In this way, traversing the three realms and five destinies,
one leaves and produces the ninety-eight latent afflictions.

Poisons have the meaning of being deeply poisonous.

Therefore, they are called deeply poisonous.

they are called poisons.
First, the poison of greed - the mind of attraction is called greed.
If one uses a deluded mind to face all favorable objects,

this is the poison of greed.
Traversing the three realms and five destinies,
the fifteen latent afflictions of greed are all the poison of greed.

Second, the poison of anger - the mind of resentment against what is contrary is called anger.

ignorance and non-understanding arise,

Giving rise to various wrong practices,
this is the poison of delusion.
It is also called ignorance.
There are two kinds of ignorance:
First, associated ignorance,
which is associated with and arises together with the eighty-eight afflictions in the five destinies of the three realms.
Second, non-associated ignorance,
which are the fifteen afflictions of delusion in the five destinies of the three realms.

8. The First Gate on the Five Hindrances, Part 8: The First Gate on the Five Hindrances, Part 8. The first is the hindrance of sensual desire, the second is the hindrance of ill-will, the third is the hindrance of sloth and torpor, the fourth is the hindrance of restlessness and remorse, and the fifth is the hindrance of doubt. The five hindrances are explained next after the three poisons.
If we discuss the essence of the three poisons,
how can they be different from the five hindrances?
But the categories are different,
and the names and numbers are different.
Therefore, they are distinguished next.
The reason for this is as follows.
If one sinks into the name of the poison of delusion and is apart from the Dharma of delusion,
it becomes the three hindrances of sloth and torpor, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
Together with greed and hatred, they become the five hindrances.
If the five hindrances are opened up, then afflictions are immeasurable.
The general name hindrance is used because
a hindrance has the meaning of covering and concealing.
It can cover and conceal the pure wholesome mind of the practitioner,
preventing it from developing.
Therefore, it is called a hindrance.
Since these five hindrances are specifically the main obstacles to the various dhyanas that will be explained below,
it is necessary to briefly distinguish their characteristics.
The first is the cover of greed and desire. Taking and grasping the mind without satiation is called greed and desire.
Distinguishing the essence and characteristics.
They are fully explained in the poison of greed.
The fifteen greed-based afflictions in the three realms and five types of actions.
This is the cover of greed and desire.
The second is the cover of anger and resentment. The mind of anger and resentment is called anger and resentment.
Distinguishing the essence and characteristics.
They are fully explained as above.
The five types of anger-based afflictions in the five types of actions in the desire realm.
This is the cover of anger.
The third is the cover of sleepiness. The dull and heavy state of the thinking consciousness is called sleep.
The five sense faculties being dark and unclear is called sleepiness.
If the mind relies on indeterminate [states], then ignorance increases.
Therefore, the thinking consciousness is dull and heavy.
The five sense faculties are dark and unclear, without any awareness.
This is called sleepiness.

If one indulges in ignorance and mistakenly grasps,
then frivolous discussions and a restless mind arise.
Since one's actions are contrary to the truth,
retreating to think about it, there will be worry and regret.
This is also an increase in mental factors.
It belongs to the thirty-two views to be eliminated during the path of seeing.
It includes the contemplation to be eliminated.

Fifth, the hindrance of doubt - the deluded mind seeks truth,
hesitating and indecisive.
This is called doubt.
If one cultivates the path, concentration, and other dharmas,
ignorance is dark and dull,
not distinguishing true from false,
causing hesitation to arise.
